text: To be able to tackle the problem of 'Plastic Soup' - the accumulation of plastics in aquatic environments - it is important to get insight in the extend of plastic waste pollution.
In this assignment you will get this insight for a river system, by measuring plastic waste along river shores.
You will do this by counting and categorizing items in random selected squares along a shore. This way a quick overview of plastic pollution of the river system can be obtained.

This will help formulate measures by governments, such as creating policy on certain polluting items or creating better wastmanagement, and general public, by creating awareness and local clean up actions.

steps: 2. Quadrat of 1x1m or string/cord of 4m with a marking each meter
2. Quadrat of 1x1m or string/cord of 4m with a marking each meter
5. Optional: Bin bags (for a clean up)

questions.question: Give General Info or Go to Measurements?
Location: Give the name of the location that you will measure
Characteristics: What kind of waterway are you conducting measurements at? (river/canal/stream/lake)
Characteristics: What is the width of the river (approximately)?
Characteristics: What is the average velocity (fast/slow/stagnant)?
Characteristics: Does it have a fixed or variable waterlevel?
Characteristics: Have there been recent floods or extreme water levels?
What type of riverbank is it? (Harbour wall,stone,beatch,etc.)
What is the riverbank width from waterlevel to landward edge?
Is it a steep sloping riverband? How steep (1:4 or steeper)?
Location Characteristcs: Describe the area. What are the main functions? (Residential, industry, recreation, etc.)
Location Characteristcs: Are there roads, railroads, cycling paths nearby? Please specify
Location Characteristcs: Are there rubishbins within 100 m of location? How many?
Location Characteristcs: What activities take place at and around the location? Sports, picnic, market, fishing etc)
Additional notes (conditions, descriptions of surroundings, etc):
How many squaremeters are you going to measure? (This number CANNOT be changed after you click next!)

nextcategories.answer: Candy/ sweet packets and lolly sticks
Food containers incl. fast food containers and plastic cutlery & trays
Small drink bottles 0,5 lt or smaller
Drink cups or parts of them (plastic / styrofoam)
Cosmetics (bottles & containers e.g. shampoo, shower gel, deodorant)
Cigarette lighters, pens, combs/ hair brushes, toys & party poppers
Thin string and cord (diameter < 1 cm) and tangled pieces of string/cord/net. Incl fishing line
Oil containers & drums and Jerrycans (square plastic container with handle)
Cleaner (bottles, containers and drums) and injection gun containers (for silicone etc)
Balloons, including plastic valves, ribbons, strings etc.
For example wooden beams, planks, crates, cork etc.
